When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the left.

Number | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$4$| |$\swarrow\greenD{4}$  
$10 \times 4$| $\greenD4$ | $0$

$10 \times \greenD4=\greenD40$

When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the left.

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$44$| |$\swarrow\blueD{4}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{4}$  
$44 \times 10$ |$\blueD4$ |$\greenD4$ | $0$

$\blueD4\greenD4 \times 10=\blueD4\greenD40$

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the right.

Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$4{,}000$ |$\searrow\goldD{4}$ | $\searrow\purpleD{0}$ | $\searrow\blueD{0}$ | $\searrow\greenD{0}$  
$4{,}000 \div 10$ | |$\goldD{4}$ | $\purpleD{0}$ |$\blueD{0}$

$\goldD4{,}\purpleD0\blueD0\greenD0 \div 10=\goldD4\purpleD0\blueD0$
